item.description:
Report X-2023081942

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package was discovered in unload leaking due to punctured lids. Removed immediately. DescribePack: Failed due to puncture in 2 caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to a secure QA processing area.

item.title: Report X-2023081915
item.description:
Report X-2023081915

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: KODAK
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found smoking and bubbling on door 4. Employees were cleared of the area immediately, and a callout was made to QA. QA suited up and got the hazmat placed in a red hazmat tote and moved back to the cage. The spillage on the floor was cleaned up by using cat litter as a neutralizer as was suggested for nitric acid in the safety booklet. The area was left alone until determined safe to be around. DescribePack: lid on one of the six bottles of nitric acid failed which caused the leakage and damage.. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Area was cleared, the cat litter was used as a neutralizer.

item.title: Report X-2023081890
item.description:
Report X-2023081890

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Faint flammable liquid smelled from tote containing two open metal cans of stain and soaked packaging on loadside. Tote brought to HMPA staging pallet. Barcode was deciphered. Ftrack showed a DPR had been completed the day prior and undamaged portion returned to shipper as admin did not realize product was an undeclared hazmat. Trap request sent to NSTO and CHAM to secure undamaged portion. DescribePack: Two of four 1 gallon metal cans lost all content despite paint can clips due to denting, suggesting box was dropped in transit. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation utilized, tote was used to collect spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023081879
item.description:
Report X-2023081879

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED SLIGHTLY WET IN ONE SPOT - REMOVED FROM VAN, PLACED IN TOTE AND MOVED TO CAGE. DescribePack: ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A SLIGHTLY LOOSE CAP WHICH ALLOWED SOME SLIGHT SPILLAGE ONTO THE OUTER PACKING. DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED UPRIGHT IN TOTE AND MOVED TO CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023081871
item.description:
Report X-2023081871

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a plastic pail was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the plastic pail was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: The plastic pail possessed a cap that was not securely fastened, resulting in leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the plastic pail leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report I-2023090090
item.description:
Report I-2023090090

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: Nashville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During boarding of American Airlines Flight 323 a customer's 18650 lithium ion cell shorted and began to overheat in his carry-on bag. The customer brought the bag to the number 1 Flight Attendant at the front of the aircraft. The Flight Attendant obtained and placed it in a fire containment bag. The fire containment bag was removed from the aircraft and the flight departed.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the nozzle was still open for the one 250 gallon metal tote of hatchet insecticide (un3017) and had released 10 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090250
item.description:
Report X-2023090250

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed wet hazmat while unloading and alerted Unload Manager; Mgr place package in lined tote and staged at QA area DescribePack: Package was wet at one corner on one side. All caps are safety caps and none "seemed" loose. Leak was not obvious but a leak had occurred, Inner packages were slightly wet on top of bottles but none were fully covered. Inner box wet only under bottle that caused leak. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed to QA area; Package was sitting upright.

item.title: Report X-2023081821

Report X-2023081821

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found on ic belt, sent back to ic belt, came back repacked with contents still damaged. DescribePack: loose caps, wet box corners DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: kept isolated from everything else

item.title: Report X-2023081669
item.description:
Report X-2023081669

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the loading side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: The one-gallon bottles have encountered leakage as a result of a cap that was not securely fastened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023081968
item.description:
Report X-2023081968

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box with no diamond labels found on unload. Box taken to HMPA staging pallet. Upon further investigation, it was discovered package was already damaged 8/21 around 2PM at 392 JAMS, Rankin County. DPR contained observation that internal content was cracked and commented: "The white paint is busted open and spill inside the box." DescribePack: All four plastic drums lost lids, resulting in a 16lb loss of hazardous material. Two nonhazardous drums also lost content. No internal partitions found. At least one drum cracked 2" across bottom. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, SDS consulted, and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023081707
item.description:
Report X-2023081707

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • City: NASHVILLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fully regulated fiberboard box found on HMPA staging pallet. Prior events unknown. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.4 gallon from a 0.6 inch gouge to the upper corner of the bottle, not following a seam. Due to impact from a sharp object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023081618
item.description:
Report X-2023081618

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking metal drum discovered in middle area. Immediately placed in a lined tote and taken to HMPA staging pallet for further investigation. DescribePack: 1 inch crack with two smaller branches found on metal ridge of bottom of drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, SDS found attached to drum, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023081608
item.description:
Report X-2023081608

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081608 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED WET IN BULK AREA. PACKAGE REMOVED AND GIVEN TO QA DescribePack: FULL HAZMAT HAD BEEN REPACKED IN FEDEX REPACK BOX WITH NO HAZMAT LABELS ON OUTER BOX. LOOSE CAPS ON BOTTLES ALLOWED ABOUT 10 LITERS OF RAPICIDE PART B TO SPILL OUT. SOME RAPICIDE A MAY HAVE BEEN SPILLED AS WELL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN LINED CONTAINER. 2. X-2023081651 SequenceEvent: WET PACKAGE DISCOVERED IN BULK AREA. REMOVED FROM WORK AREA FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: PACKAGE FOUND REPACKED IN A PLASTIC BAG AND INSIDE A REPACK BOX. LOOSE CAPS ON BOTTLES ALLOWED CONTENTS TO SPILL OUT. BOXES WET. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN LINED CONTAINER FOR PROCESSING

DescribePack: Two of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.3 gallon of fluid due to loose cap closures and potential internal corrosion, despite tamper-resistant caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation extensive.

DescribePack: Package failed due to internal bottle's closure within package failing to operate, causing external box to be soaked in hazmat contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open contents bin and leaving for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report X-2023080951
item.description:
Report X-2023080951

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 2 boxes of paint spilled inside a ULD. One box containing 2 cans leaked, the other package was leaked on (no release). All remaining contents were placed in salvage drums and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023080441
item.description:
Report X-2023080441

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the second floor of the SPSS building for a USPS package that had caught fire. The box was observed smoking and on fire a manager in the area extinguished the fire before any other packages were affected. While investigating the Fiberboard box they discovered that it contained a cell phone. The outer fiberboard box had no haz markings or paperwork. All the contents were placed into a steel salvage package. The salvage package was turned over to USPS employees. USPS tracking# 9238590250484602328718

item.title: Report X-2023080421
item.description:
Report X-2023080421

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to heavy weight build up for a damaged haz shipment. A shipment on a wooden skid was struck by a forklift damaging one of the fiberboard boxes on the bottom row. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans all with positive closure rings and were separated with fiberboard dividers. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080420
item.description:
Report X-2023080420

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agents was dispatched to the dangerous goods building for a leaking fiberboard package. The box contained 2 paint cans and fiberboard dividers. There was no positive closure on the paint cans. Each paint can was enclosed in a single clear plastic bag sealed via bag tie. The lids on both paint cans were slightly ajar allowing the leakage of content. Shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080419
item.description:
Report X-2023080419

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Fiberboard package was presented to the Memphis spill office as an odor. While investigating the package the spill agent observed that the single metal can inside had released its contents inside of the fiberboard box. The metal can was not packaged with positive closure and had styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080418
item.description:
Report X-2023080418

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the Dangerous Goods Building for a fiber board box with signs of release. The box contained 20 bottles of various sizes. The bottles were separated into 4 separate clear plastic bags sealed via bag ties. Each individual bottle was enclosed in bubble wrap and wrapped in a hazmat pad. One of the bottles was shattered and released all of its contents. The shipper was contacted for an amened declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080411
item.description:
Report X-2023080411

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the Dangerous goods building for a fiberboard box with signs of a release. The agents was told that the fiberboard box had been dropped during the unloading process. Inside of the fiberboard box were four metal jerrycans. One of the jerrycans had a damaged bottom chime causing to release it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Plastic jerrycan was dropped during the unloading process at the Memphis dangerous goods building. The jerrycan hit the corner of the catwalk causing a puncture on the bottom. The jerrycan was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
